overview:
Joe Josephson is a Partner in Union Square Advisors. Prior to joining Union Square, Mr. Josephson was a Senior Partner at Lazard Freres focusing on cross-border transactions in the technology sector.

Prior to joining Lazard, he was a Managing Director in Mergers & Acquisitions in both the CSFB Technology Group and the DMG Technology Group. He led execution teams on numerous high-profile transactions, and his clients included Platinum Technology, the Gartner Group, Chiron, Siemens, Viag AG and NTT.

Mr. Josephson began his career in Morgan Stanleyâ€™s Mergers & Acquisitions Group in New York in 1988. He subsequently moved to Hong Kong to run the firmâ€™s M&A practice in non-Japan Asia. When Robert Greenhill left Morgan Stanley to become Chairman and CEO of Smith Barney (now Citigroup), he hired Mr. Josephson to run the firmâ€™s Investment Banking Division in Asia. While serving in that role, Smith Barney lead-managed its first non-US Dollar denominated IPO (Qingling Motors), and Mr. Josephson advised numerous multinationals on their entry into the Chinese market, including the Sprint Corporation and Universal Studios.
